{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mucins are a family of high molecular weight, heavily glycosylated proteins. Overexpression of mucins has been associated with many diseases, particularly cancers. For example, MUC1, a type of mucin, is overexpressed in many types of cancer, including breast, ovarian, and pancreatic cancers. Therefore, mucin overexpression is indeed associated with disease.", "answer_choice": "A"}
